author: ajsutton
content: Yeah I think this is the wrong thing to do. It's fine to embed the terminalBlockNumber and terminalBlockHash into the client as an optimisation but that's not the same as setting the override terminal number and hash and shouldn't be used in the engine_exchangeConfiguration response or we'll have to teach users to ignore the big scary warnings that were put there deliberately to tell them about a misconfiguration and shouldn't be ignored.

author: suburbandad_
content:
yeah my understand of what the post-merge fork consisted of must be dated.  

knowing the terminal block hash when syncing could be useful, but forkId_next serves the same purpose.  Removed.

author: ajsutton
content: I can definitely see that knowing the terminal block hash could be useful, it's just a different value to the terminal block hash *override* which is a user specified config option.  There's no reason you couldn't track both if its helpful, just need to keep them separate enough to return the right thing in engine_exchangeConfiguration
